sen.j: 堤 代長（つつみ しろなが、正徳 (日本)6年2月20日 (旧暦)（1716年3月13日） - 天明3年11月28日 (旧暦)（1783年12月21日））は、江戸時代の公卿。
sen.e: Shironaga TSUTSUMI (March 13, 1716 - December 21, 1783) was Kugyo (high court noble) in the Edo period.
Shironaga TSUTSUMI (March 13, 1716 - December 21, 1783) was a Kugyo (high court noble) in the Edo period.
Shironaga TSUTSUMI (March 13, 1716 - December 21, 1783) was a Kugyo (high court noble) in the Edo period.

sen.j: 名家 (公家)の家格である堤家の7代当主。
sen.e: He was the seventh family head of the Tsutsumi family, which was meike (or meika) (the fourth highest status for court nobles).
He was the seventh head of the Tsutsumi family, which was Meike (or Meika) (the fourth highest status for court nobles).
He was the seventh head of the Tsutsumi family, which was Meike (or Meika) (the fourth highest status for court nobles).

sen.j: 養父は堤家6代当主・堤晴長。
sen.e: His foster father was the sixth family head of the Tsutsumi family, Harunaga TSUTSUMI.
His foster father was the sixth head of the Tsutsumi family, Harunaga TSUTSUMI.
His foster father was the sixth head of the Tsutsumi family, Harunaga TSUTSUMI.
His real father was Toshikiyo BOJO.
His biological father was Toshikiyo BOJO.
His biological father was Toshikiyo BOJO.

sen.j: 母は堤家3代当主・堤輝長の娘。
sen.e: His mother was the daughter of Terunaga TSUTSUMI, the third family head of the Tsutsumi family.
His mother was a daughter of Terunaga TSUTSUMI, the third head of the Tsutsumi family.
His mother was a daughter of Terunaga TSUTSUMI, the third head of the Tsutsumi family.
His lawful wife was the daughter of Korenaga TAKENOUCHI.
His lawful wife was the daughter of Korenaga TAKENOUCHI.
His lawful wife was the daughter of Korenaga TAKENOUCHI.

sen.j: 子に堤栄長、若江長山（若江家養嗣子）、葉室頼凞。
sen.e: Yukinaga TSUTSUMI, Chozan WAKAE (adopted by the Wakae family), 頼凞 HAMURO were his sons.
sen.cmt: 「長山」、「頼凞」の読み方不明。一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Yukinaga TSUTSUMI, Chozan WAKAE (adopted heir of the Wakae family), Yorihiro HAMURO were his sons.
sen.cmt: 頼凞は「よりひろ」です。http://www1.parkcity.ne.jp/sito/k70.html長山は「ちょうざん」としています。（確認できる資料が見つかりませんでした）
sen.e: Yukinaga TSUTSUMI, Chozan WAKAE (adopted heir of the Wakae family), Yorihiro HAMURO were his sons.

sen.j: 春光院 (島津重豪側室)（薩摩藩主・島津重豪側室。
sen.e: Shunkoin (concubine of Shigehide SHIMAZU, the lord of Satsuma domain,
sen.cmt: 重複している「(島津重豪側室)」は削除して訳しました。一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Shunkoin who was the concubine of Shigehide SHIMAZU, the lord of Satsuma domain,
Shunkoin who was the concubine of Shigehide SHIMAZU, the lord of Satsuma domain,
mother of Narinobu SHIMAZU,
and the biological mother of Narinobu SHIMAZU,

sen.j: お千万の方）、玉沢（大奥上臈御年寄）、娘（石野基綱室）らがいる。
sen.e: also called "Osenman-no-kata"), Tamazawa (chief Joro [high rank woman servant] in O-oku [the inner halls of Edo Castle where the wife of the Shogun and her servants reside], and the wife of Mototsuna IWANO were his daughters.

(also known as Osenman no kata), Tamasawa (chief Joro [high rank woman servant] in O-oku [the inner halls of Edo Castle where the wife of the Shogun and her servants reside]), and the wife of Mototsuna IWANO were his daughters.
sen.cmt: 下記サイトでは「たまさわ」となっています。http://data.lullar.com/%E5%A4%A7%E5%A5%A5
sen.e: (also known as Osenman no kata), Tamasawa (chief Joro [high rank woman servant] in O-oku [the inner halls of Edo Castle where the wife of the Shogun and her servants reside]), and the wife of Mototsuna IWANO were his daughters.
His official court rank was Shonii (Senior Second Rank), Chunagon (Middle Councilor).
